table.name: citations
table.remarks: Table that records information for citations from which data

column.name: author
column.remarks: last name of first author

column.name: year
column.remarks: year of publication

column.name: title
column.remarks: article title

column.name: journal
column.remarks: Journal name

column.name: pg
column.remarks: page range of article

column.name: url
column.remarks: link to article url

column.name: pdf
column.remarks: link to pdf version of article

column.name: doi
column.remarks: Digital Object Identifier

table.name: citations_sites
table.remarks: Lookup table to support many to many relationships between c

table.name: citations_treatments
table.remarks: lookup table to support many to many relationships between c

table.name: coppice
table.viewSql: select `mt`.`treatment_id` AS `treatment_id`,`mt`.`management_id` AS `management_id`,`m`.`mgmttype` AS `mgmttype`,`m`.`date` AS `date`,`m`.`level` AS `level`,`m`.`units` AS `units` from (`bety`.`managements` `m` join `bety`.`managements_treatments` `mt` on((`m`.`id` = `mt`.`management_id`))) where (`m`.`mgmttype` = 'coppice')

column.name: mgmttype
column.remarks: Type of management

column.name: date
column.remarks: Date on which management was conducted.

column.name: level
column.remarks: Amount applied, not always required.

column.name: units
column.remarks: units, standardized for each management type.

table.name: covariates
table.remarks: The covariate table records conditions under which a measure

column.name: level
column.remarks: Value of covariate, units are determined in variables table by the variable_id foreign key.

table.name: cultivars
table.remarks: The cultivar table records genotype or cultivar information

column.name: name
column.remarks: Cultivar name given by breeder or reported in citation.

column.name: ecotype
column.remarks: Does not apply for all species, used in the case of switchgrass to differentiate lowland and upland genotypes.

table.name: managements
table.remarks: A managment is an action that occurs at a specific time and

column.name: date
column.remarks: Date on which management was conducted.

column.name: dateloc
column.remarks: Level of confidence in value given as date. See documentation for details.

column.name: mgmttype
column.remarks: Type of management

column.name: level
column.remarks: Amount applied, not always required.

column.name: units
column.remarks: units, standardized for each management type.

table.name: managements_treatments
table.remarks: lookup table for many to many relationship between managemen

table.name: mgmtview
table.viewSql: select `bety`.`yields`.`id` AS `yield_id`,`bety`.`planting`.`date` AS `planting`,`bety`.`seeding`.`date` AS `seeding`,`coppice`.`date` AS `coppice` from (((`bety`.`yields` left join `bety`.`planting` on((`bety`.`yields`.`treatment_id` = `bety`.`planting`.`treatment_id`))) left join `bety`.`seeding` on((`bety`.`yields`.`treatment_id` = `bety`.`seeding`.`treatment_id`))) left join `bety`.`coppice` on((`bety`.`yields`.`treatment_id` = `coppice`.`treatment_id`)))

column.name: planting
column.remarks: Date on which management was conducted.

column.name: seeding
column.remarks: Date on which management was conducted.

column.name: coppice
column.remarks: Date on which management was conducted.

table.name: pfts
table.remarks: The pfts table is used to associate a set of species with a

column.name: definition
column.remarks: Defines the creator and context under which the pft will be used.

column.name: name
column.remarks: unique identifier used by PEcAn.

table.name: pfts_priors
table.remarks: Lookup table for many to many relationship between pfts and

table.name: pfts_species
table.remarks: Lookup table for many to many relationship between pfts and

table.name: planting
table.viewSql: select `mt`.`treatment_id` AS `treatment_id`,`mt`.`management_id` AS `management_id`,`m`.`mgmttype` AS `mgmttype`,`m`.`date` AS `date`,`m`.`level` AS `level`,`m`.`units` AS `units` from (`bety`.`managements` `m` join `bety`.`managements_treatments` `mt` on((`m`.`id` = `mt`.`management_id`))) where (`m`.`mgmttype` = 'planting')

column.name: mgmttype
column.remarks: Type of management

column.name: date
column.remarks: Date on which management was conducted.

column.name: level
column.remarks: Amount applied, not always required.

column.name: units
column.remarks: units, standardized for each management type.

table.name: priors
table.remarks: Prior distirbutions, one per trait per pft, can be used in m

column.name: variable_id
column.remarks: Links to variable for which prior is used.

column.name: phylogeny
column.remarks: Used to note the group of plants for which the prior was specified, often the group of plants represented by the data used to specify the prior.

column.name: distn
column.remarks: Name of the probability distribution, using R naming convention (e.g. 'beta','f', 'gamma', 'lnorm', 'norm', 'pois', 't', 'unif', 'weibull'.

column.name: parama
column.remarks: First parameter for distribution, as specified by R.

column.name: paramb
column.remarks: Second parameter for distribution, as specified by R.

column.name: paramc
column.remarks: A third parameter, if required.

column.name: n
column.remarks: number of observations used to specify prior.

table.name: seeding
table.viewSql: select `mt`.`treatment_id` AS `treatment_id`,`mt`.`management_id` AS `management_id`,`m`.`mgmttype` AS `mgmttype`,`m`.`date` AS `date`,`m`.`level` AS `level`,`m`.`units` AS `units` from (`bety`.`managements` `m` join `bety`.`managements_treatments` `mt` on((`m`.`id` = `mt`.`management_id`))) where (`m`.`mgmttype` in ('seeding','seed_density','row_spacing'))

column.name: mgmttype
column.remarks: Type of management

column.name: date
column.remarks: Date on which management was conducted.

column.name: level
column.remarks: Amount applied, not always required.

column.name: units
column.remarks: units, standardized for each management type.

table.name: sites
table.remarks: Table of site-level information. A site is a unique location

column.name: city
column.remarks: Nearest city to site.

column.name: state
column.remarks: If in the United States, state in which study is conducted.

column.name: lat
column.remarks: Latitude, in decimal degrees

column.name: lon
column.remarks: Longitude, in decimal degrees.

column.name: mat
column.remarks: Mean Annual Temperature (C)

column.name: map
column.remarks: Mean Annual Precipitation (mm)

column.name: masl
column.remarks: Elevation (m above sea level)

column.name: soil
column.remarks: Soil type, as described in documentation.

column.name: greenhouse
column.remarks: Boolean: indicates if study was conducted in a field (0) or greenhouse, pot, or growth chamber (1)

table.name: species
table.remarks: Table of species level information, for plants occurring in

column.name: site_id
column.remarks: Site at which measurement was taken.

column.name: specie_id
column.remarks: Species on which measurement was taken.

column.name: citation_id
column.remarks: Citation in which data was originally reported.

column.name: cultivar_id
column.remarks: Cultivar information, if any.

column.name: treatment_id
column.remarks: Experimental treatment identification. Required, can indicate observational study.

column.name: date
column.remarks: Date on which measurement was made.

column.name: dateloc
column.remarks: Level of confidence in date. See documentation.

column.name: time
column.remarks: Time at which measurement was taken. Sometimes necessary, e.g. for photosynthesis measurements.

column.name: timeloc
column.remarks: Level of confidence in time.

column.name: mean
column.remarks: Mean value of trait.

column.name: n
column.remarks: Number of experimental replicates used to estimate mean and statistical summary.

column.name: statname
column.remarks: Name of reported statistic.

column.name: stat
column.remarks: Value of reported statistic.

column.name: variable_id
column.remarks: Links to information in variables table that describes trait being measured.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: ID of user who entered data.

column.name: checked
column.remarks: accepts values [-1, 0, 1]. 0 is default, and means that data have not been checked. 1 indicates that the data have been checked and are correct, -1 indicates that data have been checked and found to be incorrect or suspicious, e.g. outside of the acceptab

column.name: access_level
column.remarks: Level of access required to view data.

table.name: treatments
table.remarks: Treatments holds a separate record for each treatment in a s

column.name: name
column.remarks: Name of treatment, should be easy to associate with treatment name in original study.

column.name: definition
column.remarks: Description of treatment, e.g. levels of fertilizer applied, etc. This information may be redundant with 'levels' information recorded in Managements table.

column.name: control
column.remarks: Boolean, indicates if treatment is a control or observational (1) or experimental treatment (0).

table.name: users
table.remarks: Records basic information about BETY users and contributors.

column.name: login
column.remarks: login id

column.name: name
column.remarks: User name

column.name: email
column.remarks: email address

column.name: access_level
column.remarks: data to which user has access

column.name: page_access_level
column.remarks: Determines the extent of data, if any, that user can edit.

table.name: variables
table.remarks: Defines variables used in traits, priors, and covariates tab

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description or definition of variable.

column.name: units
column.remarks: units in which data must be entered.

column.name: name
column.remarks: variable name, this is the name used by PEcAn and in other modeling contexts.

table.name: yields
table.remarks: Table for recording yield (i.e.: aboveground biomass) data.

column.name: citation_id
column.remarks: Citation in which data originally reported.

column.name: site_id
column.remarks: Site at which crop was harvested.

column.name: specie_id
column.remarks: Species for which yield was measured.

column.name: treatment_id
column.remarks: Experimental treatment identification. Required, can indicate observational study.

column.name: cultivar_id
column.remarks: Cultivar information, if any.

column.name: date
column.remarks: Date on which crop was harvested.

column.name: dateloc
column.remarks: Level of confidence in harvest date. See documentation.

column.name: statname
column.remarks: Name of reported statistic.

column.name: stat
column.remarks: Value of reported statistic.

column.name: mean
column.remarks: Mean yield reported.

column.name: n
column.remarks: Number of replicates used to estimate mean and statistical summary.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: ID of user who entered data.

column.name: checked
column.remarks: accepts values [-1, 0, 1]. 0 is default, and means that data have not been checked. 1 indicates that the data have been checked and are correct, -1 indicates that data have been checked and found to be incorrect or suspicious, e.g. outside of the acceptab

column.name: access_level
column.remarks: Level of access required to view data.

table.name: yields_view
table.viewSql: select `bety`.`yields`.`id` AS `yield_id`,`bety`.`yields`.`citation_id` AS `citation_id`,`bety`.`yields`.`site_id` AS `site_id`,`bety`.`sites`.`sitename` AS `site`,`bety`.`sites`.`lat` AS `lat`,`bety`.`sites`.`lon` AS `lon`,`bety`.`species`.`scientificname` AS `sp`,`bety`.`citations`.`author` AS `author`,`bety`.`citations`.`year` AS `cityear`,`bety`.`treatments`.`name` AS `trt`,`bety`.`yields`.`date` AS `date`,month(`bety`.`yields`.`date`) AS `month`,year(`bety`.`yields`.`date`) AS `year`,`bety`.`yields`.`mean` AS `mean`,`bety`.`yields`.`n` AS `n`,`bety`.`yields`.`statname` AS `statname`,`bety`.`yields`.`stat` AS `stat`,`bety`.`yields`.`notes` AS `notes`,`bety`.`users`.`name` AS `user`,`bety`.`yields`.`checked` AS `checked`,`bety`.`yields`.`access_level` AS `access_level`,`bety`.`yields`.`user_id` AS `user_id` from (((((`bety`.`yields` join `bety`.`sites` on((`bety`.`yields`.`site_id` = `bety`.`sites`.`id`))) join `bety`.`species` on((`bety`.`yields`.`specie_id` = `bety`.`species`.`id`))) join `bety`.`citations` on((`bety`.`yields`.`citation_id` = `bety`.`citations`.`id`))) join `bety`.`treatments` on((`bety`.`yields`.`treatment_id` = `bety`.`treatments`.`id`))) join `bety`.`users` on((`bety`.`yields`.`user_id` = `bety`.`users`.`id`)))

column.name: citation_id
column.remarks: Citation in which data originally reported.

column.name: site_id
column.remarks: Site at which crop was harvested.

column.name: lat
column.remarks: Latitude, in decimal degrees

column.name: lon
column.remarks: Longitude, in decimal degrees.

column.name: author
column.remarks: last name of first author

column.name: cityear
column.remarks: year of publication

column.name: trt
column.remarks: Name of treatment, should be easy to associate with treatment name in original study.

column.name: date
column.remarks: Date on which crop was harvested.

column.name: mean
column.remarks: Mean yield reported.

column.name: n
column.remarks: Number of replicates used to estimate mean and statistical summary.

column.name: statname
column.remarks: Name of reported statistic.

column.name: stat
column.remarks: Value of reported statistic.

column.name: user
column.remarks: User name

column.name: checked
column.remarks: accepts values [-1, 0, 1]. 0 is default, and means that data have not been checked. 1 indicates that the data have been checked and are correct, -1 indicates that data have been checked and found to be incorrect or suspicious, e.g. outside of the acceptab

column.name: access_level
column.remarks: Level of access required to view data.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: ID of user who entered data.

table.name: yieldsview
table.viewSql: select `bety`.`yields`.`id` AS `yield_id`,`bety`.`yields`.`citation_id` AS `citation_id`,`bety`.`yields`.`site_id` AS `site_id`,`bety`.`sites`.`sitename` AS `site`,`bety`.`sites`.`lat` AS `lat`,`bety`.`sites`.`lon` AS `lon`,`bety`.`species`.`scientificname` AS `sp`,`bety`.`citations`.`author` AS `author`,`bety`.`citations`.`year` AS `cityear`,`bety`.`treatments`.`name` AS `trt`,`bety`.`yields`.`date` AS `date`,month(`bety`.`yields`.`date`) AS `month`,year(`bety`.`yields`.`date`) AS `year`,`bety`.`yields`.`mean` AS `mean`,`bety`.`yields`.`n` AS `n`,`bety`.`yields`.`statname` AS `statname`,`bety`.`yields`.`stat` AS `stat`,`bety`.`yields`.`notes` AS `notes`,`bety`.`users`.`name` AS `user`,`bety`.`yields`.`checked` AS `checked`,`bety`.`yields`.`access_level` AS `access_level`,`bety`.`yields`.`user_id` AS `user_id` from (((((`bety`.`yields` join `bety`.`sites` on((`bety`.`yields`.`site_id` = `bety`.`sites`.`id`))) join `bety`.`species` on((`bety`.`yields`.`specie_id` = `bety`.`species`.`id`))) join `bety`.`citations` on((`bety`.`yields`.`citation_id` = `bety`.`citations`.`id`))) join `bety`.`treatments` on((`bety`.`yields`.`treatment_id` = `bety`.`treatments`.`id`))) join `bety`.`users` on((`bety`.`yields`.`user_id` = `bety`.`users`.`id`)))

column.name: citation_id
column.remarks: Citation in which data originally reported.

column.name: site_id
column.remarks: Site at which crop was harvested.

column.name: lat
column.remarks: Latitude, in decimal degrees

column.name: lon
column.remarks: Longitude, in decimal degrees.

column.name: author
column.remarks: last name of first author

column.name: cityear
column.remarks: year of publication

column.name: trt
column.remarks: Name of treatment, should be easy to associate with treatment name in original study.

column.name: date
column.remarks: Date on which crop was harvested.

column.name: mean
column.remarks: Mean yield reported.

column.name: n
column.remarks: Number of replicates used to estimate mean and statistical summary.

column.name: statname
column.remarks: Name of reported statistic.

column.name: stat
column.remarks: Value of reported statistic.

column.name: user
column.remarks: User name

column.name: checked
column.remarks: accepts values [-1, 0, 1]. 0 is default, and means that data have not been checked. 1 indicates that the data have been checked and are correct, -1 indicates that data have been checked and found to be incorrect or suspicious, e.g. outside of the acceptab

column.name: access_level
column.remarks: Level of access required to view data.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: ID of user who entered data.
